item.title: which professions think mainly in the moment?

Michael in Oxford, London, Bern soon on Twitter

item.title: Gorm
item.description:
Gorm on Twitter

‚ÄúAfter years of floundering, I think I‚Äôm finally getting it: You get energy by spending it. The fuel tank metaphor is completely misleading. The body supplies energy to meet demand. The tank *expands* if you use a lot of fuel. In other words, biology is fundamentally antifragile‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/metaphorician/status/1529402899016699906

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 30, 2022

item.description:
Nathan Taylor on Twitter

‚ÄúHat tip here to Arnold Kling meme on how all government policies wind up restricting supply and subsidizing demand. Once you see it, you can‚Äôt unsee it. Happens everywhere: baby formula, housing policy, education, healthcare, etc... https://t.co/KIm98AbeZQ‚Äù

item.title: Ken Kocienda
item.description:
Ken Kocienda on Twitter

‚ÄúI see so many tweets about agile, epics, scrums, story points, etc. and none of it matters. We didn‚Äôt use any of that to ship the best products years ago at Apple.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/kocienda/status/1526564983328342016

item.title: Ken Kocienda
item.description:
Ken Kocienda on Twitter

‚ÄúDo you know what worked? A clear vision. Design-led development. Weekly demos to deciders who always made the call on what to do next. Clear communication between cross functional teams. Honest feedback. Managing risk as a function of the rate of actual progress toward goals.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/kocienda/status/1526564985995857921

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 30, 2022
